result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called @ 10:51 AM Defendant Joshua Nathaniel Hayes in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court for Joshua Nathaniel Hayes.  Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF87 - The Court entertains wavier of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 22CF87: Cts 1, 2 & 4 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 22CF87: Cts 3 & 5 - DRI. 22CF7 - DRI. 22TR801 & 22TR802 - DRI. No statement by DE. Court orders: Ct 1 - 135 days WC Jail - GT, 102 days CFTS - Time served sentence, $500 fine plus costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, $42.50 Blood Draw fee w/ 60 DTP or PP, 12 mo DL rev, NO IID. Cts 2 & 4 - S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: DE to obtain a HSED or GED, AODA and follow through, DE must maintain absolute sobriety, DE may not be present upon the premises of any bars except in furtherance of his employment, DE is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the manner of operation, defendant is prohibited from being in possession of any dangerous weapons, the Court orders forfeiture and destruction of the seized electric weapon, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP,  DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow appeared by phone for Joshua Nathaniel Hayes.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke appeared by Zoom for State of Wisconsin. Atty Zamzow advises the parties await lab results. Court orders the case put into suspended status and schedule a Prelim. Hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2022 at 10:45 am.
